page.title: 06CHURCHES
page.content: {St.Margaret's,Crick.}Nobody can say exactly how old the church is but there definitely was one at the time of the Norman Conquest.The main building is about 700 yrs old and is sandstone.{The Font}is a place for baptising children.Holding up this are some grotesque figures made of sand stone.They are known to be as old as the church,possibly dating from an earlier church.An appeal for Â£40000 has been started to restore the church.The windows are guarded by nets to prevent them being broken by vandals. {Kilsby Church.}Rev.Scott looks after this church which is also in need of restoring.The church has a clock tower with 4 bells in it.The organ is next to the altar.The Sunday Service is at 10.00a.m. and the Cubs,Brownies, Scouts and Guides attend every month.
